summary: This mod aims to enhance your smithing experience by making more items craftable.
descriptionHtml:
[center][url=http://skyrimnexus.com/downloads/file.php?id=799][img]http://i.imgur.com/vzB2q.png[/img][/url]
[size=4][b]By AeonVita[/b][/size]

[size=4][b][u]Short description[/u][/b][/size]
This mod aims to enhance your smithing experience by making more items craftable.

Please watch this video by Gopher showcasing the mod. (Two minutes in)
[url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NRKfKfdVCb8#t=120s]Skyrim Mod Sanctuary - Part 5 : Dragon Armor[/url]

[size=4][b][u]My other mods[/u][/b][/size]
[url=http://skyrimnexus.com/downloads/file.php?id=1935][img]http://i.imgur.com/kN56L.png[/img][/url][url=http://skyrimnexus.com/downloads/file.php?id=3226][img]http://i.imgur.com/Q3CqO.png[/img][/url]
[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=10087][img]http://i.imgur.com/zY24v.png[/img][/url][url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=9926][img]http://i.imgur.com/yCqz9.png[/img][/url][url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/26693/][img]http://i.imgur.com/Hvq3L.png[/img][/url][/center]

[size=4]20.11.12 - Now one year old![/size]

[size=4]Now available on the [url=http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=10683]Steam Workshop[/url]![/size] (Do not use if you want a non-English version or having choices besides the default)

[size=4][b][u]Description[/u][/b][/size]
The mod consists of several standalone files which makes different sorts of items craftable. The items are located in the categories that I see fitting, currently I know of no good way of making new categories, it seems like it\'s what you\'d call \"hardcoded\" into the game. The recipes for the items contain a maximum of five ingredients, all of which are items that are pretty reasonable for the item you are making [b]in my opinion[/b]. I haven\'t been able to put very much effort and time into choosing the items though. Besides items, some do also require having completed a certain quest, or having a certain item in your inventroy.

[size=4][b][u]Normal[/u][/b][/size] (Main)
The mod makes different kinds of weapons and armor craftable. The stuff that\'s made craftable in this part are mostly not \"unique\" items. Some of the items that\'s made craftable do usually come with an enchantment, but when made at the forge they will be unenchanted and enchantable like normal items. This is done by basically making a new item that\'s mostly a copy of the original, but with a couple of changes, also keep in mind that the added item will be gone if you\'d need to disable my mod. I\'ve added a couple of new misc items to simplify the process of making Fur armor and Forsworn armor.

Some items like Thieves guild armor, and blades armor requires you to either have completed a certain quest associated with the faction, or you need the \"Copycat\" perk which lets you craft items of factions you\'re not a member of. What quests are required for the items can be seen in the recipe list.

[size=4][b][u]Craftable Artifacts[/u][/b][/size]
This mod makes some of the originally unique artifacts in Skyrim craftable. You first need to have acquired the artifact the normal way, then you can craft more of it. All the recipes require a grand soul gem each, which is suppose to represent the magic required to make the enchanted item. Logically what I have in mind is \"Artifact + some raw ingredients + soul gem = 2 Artifacts\". The mod would be useful if you want more than one of a \"unique\" item, so your follower could use the item as well as yourself for example. Another scenario would be if you\'d want to dual-wield a one-handed previously unique item. Beware, it\'s definately not lore-friendly.

[size=4][b][u]Convertible Star[/u][/b][/size] (Use the version the optional downloads section, not the one in installer.)
This optional download let\'s you convert the \"Azura\'s Star\" to \"The Black Star\" and the other way around at a forge or anvil. The process consumes a charged black soul gem if you are making The Black Star and a charged grand soul gem when creating Azura\'s Star.

[size=4][b][u]Installation[/u][/b][/size]
* Some people may need to add the line \"bEnableFileSelection=1\" in the [Launcher] section of the SkyrimPrefs.ini file, in \"My documents/My Games/Skyrim/\". 
* Use [url=http://www.skyrimnexus.com/downloads/file.php?id=1690]Legendary Smithing Upgrades[/url] as well to be able to get the \"double-improvement\" for materials like leather.

[b]Nexus Mod Manager[/b]
- Press the \"Download with manager\" button for the files you want to download.
- When downloaded, activate the mod in the \"mods\" tab. Choose any options you want and press finish.
- Make sure that the added .esp files are checked in the \"Plugins\" tab.

[b]Manual[/b]
- Download the installer archive.
- Copy over the contents of the \"Data\" folder to the Skyrim data folder.
- Make the game load the esp by checking the tick-box next to the newly added esp in the Nexus Mod Manager. (There are several other ways to enable the plugin file, I recommend using NMM.)

[size=4][b][u]Uninstallation[/u][/b][/size]
[b]Nexus Mod Manager[/b]
- Deactivate the mod in the mod manager.
- Optionally remove the mod archive by pressing the X.

[b]Manual[/b]
- Remove the \".esp\" file(s) from the \"Data\" folder in your Skyrim directory.
- Delete folders called \"AeonVita\", find by searching or by browsing in textures and meshes. Make sure to only delete the \"More Craftables\" folder if you\'re using any of my other mods.
- Remove the \"STRINGS\" files that starts with \"More Craftables\" in the strings folder in your Skyrim data directory.

[size=4][b][u]Compatibility[/u][/b][/size]
* The most likely compatibility problem that could occur is that there would be duplicate entries for some items when browsing the forge/anvil menu. This occurs if some other mod also has added a way to make that item. 
* To make item go into the correct sections the mod kind of replaces the original item, only one mod can change an item this way at a time, so it may lead to that my replacement is ignored or the other mods replacement based on what load order. This could potentially lead to problems, the worst scenario would be that the game crashes.
* If any other mod adds a perk in the Smithing perk tree, it will probably conflict with this mod. It could be fixed by compatibility patches, which I could make. So please notify me if you find a conflicting mod.
* Mods that modifies the loot of Falmer or Forsworn NPCs may conflict, so that only one mods changes will be available to the user. This could as well be fixed by compatibility patches, which I could make. So please notify me if you find a conflicting mod.
* If you for some reason are on a version of Skyrim below 1.5 then use an older version than 2.3.2 to not experience crafting xp issues.

[size=4][b][u]Load Order Notes[/u][/b][/size]
Load \"More Craftables.esp\" before: 
\"VariousGuardReplacer.esp\" - Various Guards Outfits
(probably to be expanded)

[size=4][b][u]Localization[/u][/b][/size]
Translations have been made for these languages: English, Czech, German, Italian, Russian, Spanish, Polish and Japanese. The Japanese translation may cause crashes, I\'m not able to test it properly. A few translations have been made using Google Translate, if they\'re wrong, please blame Google and/or send me a message with a correction if you can. If your language isn\'t mentioned, the item names will be shown as \"LOOKUP FAILED\". You could rename the \"More Craftables_English.strings\" to match your language which should make them appear in English on any language.

[b]Credit for translations[/b]
Sharanis Khan le faussaire - For the French translations.
aohige - For Japanese translations.
archerarcher and uptodown - For German translations.
(I\'ve most likely forgotten more, please tell me if that\'s the case)

[size=4][b][u]Added Items[/u][/b][/size]
[b]Name - How to get[/b]
Small Animal Pelt - Made from Fox, Ice Wolf, Snow Fox, Wolf, Deer or Goat pelts at tanning rack.
Large Animal Pelt - Made from Bear, Cave Bear, Sabre Cat, Sabre Cat Snow, Snow Bear or Werewolf pelts at tanning rack.
Gold Fabric - Combine Gold Ingot and Linen Wrap at forge (gives 4 fabric pieces).
Forsworn Crafting Instructions - Dropped by most types of Forsworn.
Falmer Crafting Instructions - Dropped by most types of Falmer.

Nightingale Blade - Misc - 1 Grand Soul Gem + 3 Ebony Ingot + 2 Steel Ingot
Sanguine Rose - Misc - 2 Firewood + 3 Void Salts + 1 Daedra Heart + 1 Grand Soul Gem
Volendrung - Misc - 3 Void Salts + 1 Daedra Heart + 10 Ebony Ingot + 1 Grand Soul Gem
Wabbajack - Misc - 10 Ebony Ingot + 5 Sweet Roll + 2 Skeever Tail + 1 Wooden Ladle + 1 Nirnroot + 5 Carrot + 1 Grand Soul Gem
Ebony Mail - Ebony - 6 Ebony Ingot + 3 Leather Strips + 1 Daedra Heart + 1 Grand Soul Gem
Spellbreaker - Misc - 4 Refined Moonstone + 1 Grand Soul Gem + 1 Daedra Heart + 6 Dwarven Metal Ingot + 2 Ebony Ingot + 2 Leather Strips
Shield of Ysgramor - Misc - 1 Grand Soul Gem + 8 Steel Ingot + 8 Ebony Ingot + 2 Leather Strips
The Rueful Axe - Misc - 6 Steel Ingot + 6 Ebony Ingot + 1 Daedra Heart + 1 Grand Soul Gem
Masque of Clavicus Vile - Ebony - 4 Steel Ingot + 6 Ebony Ingot + 1 Daedra Heart + 2 Leather + 1 Grand Soul Gem
[/font][/size]
(Crafting any of them requires the Dragon Smithing perk)

[size=4][b][u]Issues/bugs[/u][/b][/size]
* The translations on some languages may be incorrect, please blame Google Translate, and/or send me a message with a correction if you can.
* The arcane blacksmithing perk may affect the improving of unenchanted added items, which it shouldn\'t.
* Some users seem to have a problem with the improvements requiring void salts. Seitoth came with this possible solution: \"Ok for future reference if anyone has this issue. If you have the quest item \"Finely Cut Void Salts\" in your inventory it will negate the upgrade ability. Kind of like not being able to use Giant\'s toes for alchemy if you need to remake the staff from A night to Remember. The crafting table must be classifying all void salts as a quest item with that being active.\"
* Nightingale quest check doesn\'t work?

[size=4][b][u]How this was made[/u][/b][/size]
(All in this section is pre-creation kit.)
First of all, this is not rocket science. With some time, commitment and some knowledge of computing, I believe most people can create a mod like this.

The only tool I\'ve used to create this mod is the \"TESsnip\" tool that\'s built into the Fallout Mod Manager available [url=http://www.fallout3nexus.com/downloads/file.php?id=640]here[/url]. There is also a version of TESSnip with some changes made for Skyrim by TheFigment(aka \"The Hologram\") available [url=http://www.skyrimnexus.com/downloads/file.php?id=5064]here[/url]. It includes partial support for the new way Skyrim handles strings.

I started to learn about how to make the required changes by looking at the structure of Samutz mod \"Arrowsmith\" that makes some other stuff craftable. What\'s needed is that you basically copy a \"record\" in a \"COBJ\" group for an item that\'s already craftable. Then you need to kind of \"hex-edit\" some \"subrecords\" that\'s linked to the record. The names of the subrecords that have been edited are EDID, CNTO, CNAM and NAM1. EDID is a name for the recipe (not seen in game). There is a CNTO subrecord for every item required, it contains an item id and the number of those needed. The CNAM subrecord contains the item id and count of the item you are crafting. The NAM1 subrecord contains the amount of the item mentioned in CNAM that the player will receive when crafting. To make it require a perk I\'ve you could copy the \"CTDA\" subrecord from an item that requires a certain perk. To make an item improvable you could find an original \"Temper...\" record for an item that\'s similar to the one you want to make improvable, copy that record to your .esp and edit the \"CNAM\" subrecord to represent your item and the \"CNTO\" for required items. I could explain everything in more detail, but I believe that you should be able to figure out the rest. Hopefully this will be of some help to someone.

Samutz have recently posted this tutorial on the Bethsoft forum, it\'s far more extensive than what I\'ve written above: http://forums.bethsoft.com/index.php?/topic/1286593-tutorial-making-new-smithing-recipes-pre-ck/

Another useful tool that\'s helpful when trying to figure out the structure is [url=http://skyrimnexus.com/downloads/file.php?id=165]Skyrim Viewer[/url] by lojack. A very nice feature is that it shows you what stuff the FormID\'s in the subrecords represent.

[size=4][b][u]How to help[/u][/b][/size]
If you\'re interested in helping out you could suggest items that you think should be made craftable together with the items that you think should be required. Send it in a PM or comment on this page. If I think that your proposal is reasonable I\'ll most likely implement it, and my process will then have been simplified a bit (it can be rather difficult to think of good combinations for some items). You could write it in this format for example:
Silver Sword - 1 Steel Ingot + 1 Leather Strips + 2 Silver Ingots

You can also help out with the translations. If you notice that some item is appearing in English, or is incorrectly translated when running a non-English version, please submit a better translation via a comment or PM.

[size=1][font=\"Microsoft Sans Serif\"]2.4.2 - 12.11.12
* Fixed Russian translation.
2.4.1 - 20.10.12
* Added installer option to install a \"No Perk\" version. No reason for updating if not interested in that.
2.4 - 06.05.12
* Remake of the Craftable Artifacts. It now works by only requiring the player to have the item in the inventory to be able to craft another one, with some extra ingredients. 
* Many more items available in Craftable Artifacts.
2.3.2 - 21.03.12
* Update to fix 1.5 xp issues.
2.3.1 - 13.02.12
* Now on the Steam workshop!
* Very minor changes.
* Some bugfixing in Craftable Artifacts and Convertible Star.
2.3 - 02.02.12
* Made several types of robes craftable, check the recipe list for details.
* Mystic Tuning Gloves made craftable.
* Added Gold Fabric item that can be crafted from gold ingots and is needed for making some items. 
* Added \"Crafting Instructions\" items needed for crafting Forsworn and Falmer, dropped by one in ten of respective creature/npc.
* Localization updates.
* Some fixes to Craftable Artifacts. Keening and Ebony Blade is now craftable.
* Minor installer updates.
* Fix to executioner gear.
2.2 - 12.01.12
* Added a \"Copycat\" perk which lets you craft armors and weapons of factions you\'re not a member of. It requires a smithing level of 80 currently, this may very well change later on. 
* Lowered the required level to 15 for the items previously requiring 20.
2.1.1 - 10.01.12

2.1 - 10.01.12

2.0.1 - 04.01.12

2.0 - 03.01.12

1.9 - 22.12.11
* Christmas update! Lots of more items made craftable, see the recipe list for details.
1.8 - 29.11.11

1.7 - 27.11.11
* Bugfixes. 
* Fur and Forsworn armor are now made using the added items \"Small Animal Pelt\" and \"Big Animal Pelt\". These are in turn acquired by processing different sorts of animal hides/furs at the tanning rack.
1.6 - 27.11.11
* Bugfixes.
* Added Fur armor and nightingale weapons 
* More items upgradable.
1.5 - 26.11.11
* The items that previously were made enchanted comes unenchanted and can be enchanted like a normal item. The way I\'ve done this fixes some compatibility issues. It was done by basically making a new item that\'s mostly a copy of the original, but with a couple of changes, also keep in mind that the added item will be gone if you\'d need to disable my mod. A soul gem is no longer needed ofc. 
* Also bothered to set unique FormIDs for all recipes (even though it probably doesn\'t matter).
1.4 ALTERNATIVE - 25.11.11
* As a temporary fix for some compability problems with sylkwyrm\'s \"Enchantable Unique Armours and Reclassified Masks\" (and possible other mods) I\'m releasing this version. Most of the items made craftable will appear in incorrect categories when smithing, all of the changes to fix that is removed. The items that\'s made pre-enhanced are no longer craftable. There should also be no localization problems as a side effect of removing the item changes.
